channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: CPAN - As Seen From Space!
item.description: This was announced in many channels but here you can also see some funny comments such as 'Thanks for spending your time developing a way for me to waste mine :)'. Grant McLean created a map of all CPAN. You can slice it and dice it. See the authors, the dependencies or the users of a module.

item.title: Booking.com Donate Another €100,000
item.description: This donation is towards the development of perl 5. I wish other companies would now approach The Perl Foundation and offer further donations to enable larger grants for CPAN module development and for Perl 6 development.

item.title: 8 days of Perl during Hanukkah (חנוכה)
item.description: Just as the Advent calendars near their end, Hanukkah starts on 21st December. RJBS (aka Ricardo Signes) is trying to repeat the miracle and use his oil candle to write about Perl for 8 days.

item.title: Alternative Dancer Templating Engines
item.description: Michał Wojciechowski reviews 3 templating systems that work with Dancer: Tiny (based on Template::Tiny), Tenjin and Haml which is coming from the Ruby on Rails folks.

item.title: When slower is better: Secure your passwords
item.description: Sebastian Willing (Sewi) explains how to store passwords in a very secure way and how to maintain or even increase the security level while cracking passwords is getting faster and faster.

item.title: Writing API clients in Perl and Python
item.description: Mark Allen has implemented the API of the Ge.tt file sharing service in both languages and praises CPAN and its tool-chain for making his life easier.

item.title: Meta-programming: what, why and how
item.description: This article by Jonathan Worthington can be interesting to anyone who uses Object Oriented programming.

item.title: Define grammars in regular expressions
item.description: brian d foy uses named subpatterns introduced in perl 5.10 to build a grammar.

item.title: Stick it to them...[
item.description: The Perl Foundation has a new sticker and I have already asked Mark Keating (MKD) to send me a few for the Israeli Perl Workshop.

item.title: MetaCPAN logo competition announced
item.description: Want to get $400 and eternal fame? Just design a logo for MetaCPAN!

item.title: Learning music notes with Perl
item.description: Viacheslav Tykhanovskyi (vti) bought a MIDI 2 USB interface and had to try it with Perl. You will see how he used MIDI::ALSA from CPAN to make it work.

item.title: Bailador — A small Dancer clone
item.description: A minimal Dancer clone implemented in Perl 6. Unlike the real Dancer which is very jumpy, this fits more people who like slow dance. I like both.
